answers.answer: 239 is not dangerous in the short term, however BL that high for years will cause damage, blindness loss of feeling in feet/toes leading to loss of toes/feet.you need to see an MD for treatment options.  Dont ignore this... it will bite you if ignored

Here is information from MedHelp.org and the Sugar Sense app on high and low blood glucose numbers, and what everyday effects they're linked to (when you have diabetes).http://www.medhelp.org/diabetes/articles/Make-Sense-of-Your-Blood-Sugar/1773As our member mentioned, the symptoms of high blood sugar numbers can compound over time into serious effects, including Type 2 diabetes, if you're not already diagnosed.Our Sugar Sense app can provide you a suggested target range for your age and weight, as can your doctor, but most people with diabetes aim for 70 to 130 before eating.Good luck and come back and let us know how it's going!
I agree with diabetes86- don't ignore it- make sure you are in contact with your doctor and follow up.Let us know how you are doing!

question: Is this dangerously high?  I have never had a high result in the past.
title: I am 63, female, and just received a value of 239 on my Glucose test.
